sentences.english: Tens of thousands were stranded in other areas, the national fire service said, according to Reuters.
sentences.chinese: 據路透社報道，國家消防局說，好幾萬人身處險境。

sentences.english: The little boy was in trouble so I swam out to save him.
sentences.chinese: 這小男孩處於險境，所以我游過去救他。

sentences.english: He was little alive to the dangerous situation.
sentences.chinese: 他並沒有覺察到自己已面臨險境。

sentences.english: David found himself caught in a dangerous drama of pursuit in which King Saul tried to take his life.
sentences.chinese: 大衛發現自己身陷險境，掃羅王要取他的性命。

sentences.english: I hope she'll get out of woods.
He also said his personal safety was in jeopardy.
sentences.chinese: 他還說自己的人身安全處於險境。

sentences.english: We've seen market interest rates - which were in danger of spiralling - actually fall.
sentences.chinese: 我們看到處於暴跌險境的利率確實下跌。

sentences.english: Yet, Jiang repeatedly uses the location as an outing to the murky world of genre-film making.
sentences.chinese: 然而在電影裏，姜文屢次地把這個地方比作深入險境。

sentences.english: In be informed a world child from time to time of exclusive and alive dangerous situation of son body part runs away.
sentences.chinese: 在得知世子唯一在世的兒子身處險境時而逃走。

sentences.english: Her innocence is proven only by her proximity to danger.
sentences.chinese: 她靠她身處險境才證明了她的無辜。

sentences.english: Unless your Fight Club membership is in danger of being revoked, walk away from altercations.
sentences.chinese: 除非搏擊俱樂部的成員身處險境，不要與人爭執。

sentences.english: Only success in controlling the water can deliver the caves from danger.
sentences.chinese: 只有治水的成功，才能使洞窟脫離險境。

sentences.english: Prosperity destroys fools and endangers the wise.
sentences.chinese: 繁榮興旺既毀了蠢人，也使智者陷於險境。

sentences.english: And we fail to heed that lesson at our peril.
sentences.chinese: 但是我們在這次險境中並沒有注意到這個教訓。

sentences.english: Now that the patient is out of danger , the doctor is no longer in attendance.
sentences.chinese: 既然病人已經脫離險境，醫生就不再照顧他了。

definition: to escape (danger)/to rescue/to come out alive
in (some place)/to be in (adversity, a difficult situation, danger, turmoil etc)/to find oneself in/placed in/surrounded by
you can't guard against it (idiom)/impossible to defend effectively/not much one can do about it/It can't be prevented.
to involve/to implicate sb/to spread to others (harm, trouble, damage etc)
to resist/to make a stand and fight (against)
lit. to have one's hands bound and be unable to do anything about it (idiom); fig. helpless in the face of a crisis
no room to advance or to retreat (idiom); without any way out of a dilemma/trapped/in an impossible situation
